title: Laplace Transform Definition
description: The bilateral Laplace Transform maps a time-domain signal x(t) to the complex frequency domain X(s), where s = σ + jω.

title: Unit Impulse Transform
description: The Laplace Transform of the unit impulse is unity for all values of s.

title: Unit Step Transform
description: The unit step function transforms to 1/s with region of convergence in the right half-plane.

title: Exponential Transform
description: The causal exponential transforms to a simple pole. The ROC is to the right of the pole.

title: Ramp Transform
description: The ramp function transforms to 1/s² with a double pole at the origin.

title: Cosine Transform
description: The cosine function produces complex conjugate poles on the jω axis.

title: Sine Transform
description: The sine function produces the same denominator as cosine with a different numerator.

title: Linearity Property
description: The Laplace Transform is linear, allowing decomposition of complex signals into simpler components.

title: Time-Shifting Property
description: A time delay multiplies the transform by an exponential factor in s.

title: Time Differentiation
description: Differentiation in time corresponds to multiplication by s, with initial condition contribution.

title: Integration Property
description: Integration in time corresponds to division by s in the transform domain.

title: Capacitor Impedance
description: The s-domain impedance of a capacitor C is 1/(sC).

title: Inductor Impedance
description: The s-domain impedance of an inductor L is sL.

title: Damped Sinusoid Transform
description: An exponentially damped sinusoid has poles shifted into the left half-plane.

title: Euler's Formula
description: Euler's formula connects complex exponentials to trigonometric functions.
